Articles.Content: Is there an way to like, make the orbit be like ... an upside down orbit?I mean, not horizontally. Vertically. I need my orbit to be vertical, but how do i do it?

Erm...use Cardinal directions

You mean like instead of going east-> west (or vice versa) you want the orbit going north-> south?

In actual terms, you want a polar orbit instead of an equatorial?
Yeah! That's exactly and precisely what i mean! How do i do it?
There is a thread called orbital mechanics 101 in the How-to section. Watch the first video

If you are launching from Kerbin, then it's easy. Just don't turn to a 90 degree heading (east) turn to 0 or 360 for North, or 180 for South. Done, follow same procedures as for a normal launch. It may take a little more fuel though.

Yeah it's pretty simple, but takes a little bit of practice to get used to it.

You must remember that Kerbin is spinning West -> East, so you are already moving in that direction upon launch. Making it go perfectly Polar will take a bit more effort and require you to burn East -> West slightly

I've always found it a bit hard to do on my own.

It's easiest if done right as you launch, but it's still possible to adjust when you're in orbit

All right. Thank you very much to you guys I shall now try to do so.

EDIT: Is there an way to do that in MechJeb? So I don't have to do that over and over again. *i'm a lazy son of a... xD*

Set it to point either normal or anti-normal, and bring up the orbital info tab. Burn until the inclination is 90 degrees. Its quick and easy.
